features: 4K Clarity: Elevate your video calls and content with breathtaking 4K resolution, delivering unparalleled detail and crispness. The Opal Tadpole is your ultimate choice for professional video needs, offering top-notch video performance.
Versatile Mounting: The Opal Tadpole's mount is universally adaptable, fitting effortlessly on both slim and thick displays or securing it to any standard photography tripod.
Compact Portability: Don't be fooled by its size; the Opal Tadpole is smaller than you'd imagine compared to most webcams, making it the ideal travel companion for on-the-go professionals
Premium Build: The Opal Tadpole boasts a meticulously crafted body that seamlessly blends three distinct materials, ensuring a comfortable and visually captivating camera.
Conference-Ready: Transform any space into a professional conference room with the Opal Tadpole, ensuring clear video quality for all of your important meetings.

productInformation.name: Special Feature

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Form, Function, and Ease - Great for travel and those who appreciate AV quality
reviews.reviewText: The Opal Tadpole has surpassed my expectations, fitting seamlessly into my minimalist lifestyle with its small, portable, and aesthetically pleasing design. As a frequent traveler, its convenience shines whether I'm making a quick call from an airport lounge, the little nook at my favorite coffee shop, or my desk. The standout feature, undoubtedly, is the video quality, a crucial aspect for someone like me with a discerning eye for the nuances of video and audio due to my background as a once aspiring actor (welp).The Tadpole's picture quality compared to built-in laptop cameras has made me appreciate its value, especially in the era of remote work. The quality between the Tadpole and built-in cameras is night and day. The clarity, sharpness, and vividness of the footage make virtual interactions feel as close to in-person as possible. In hindsight, my only regret is not gifting Tadpoles to all my regular Zoom/Teams contacts. It's a camera that offers great value, particularly friendly for beginners, thanks to its clear footage and user-friendly design.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A welcome upgrade!
reviews.reviewText: I'm not normally a fan of extra accessories when I'm on the go, but the built-in camera on my older MacBook Pro was leaving a lot to be desired, so I decided to give the Tadpole a try.The improvement in video quality is immediately noticeable – crisp and clear, with vibrant colors. The setup was simple enough and the compact size doesn't take up much space in the bag. A carrying case would have been a nice feature, but not a deal breaker.The built-in microphone was better than expected, making the audio on my virtual meetings noticeably clearer (based on co-worker feedback).If you're looking for a portable solution to enhance your video calls without breaking the bank, you can't go wrong with the Tadpole.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It's fine, but all you're paying for is bokeh
reviews.reviewText: It's fine. It works. At 1080p, not 4k. Way better and more affordable options out there.This product does not work with windows.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect upgrade even for MBP
reviews.reviewText: I was on the verge of purchasing a Logitech camera when I stumbled upon this new offering from Opal. Known for their superior video quality, Opal’s products are usually on the pricier side, but this one is surprisingly affordable.The unboxing experience was delightful, akin to unwrapping a sushi roll - minimalistic, elegant, and well-organized. The webcam comes with a beautifully braided cable and an adorable cable organizer, adding to its overall charm. The rubber clips are soft yet durable, reminiscent of touching a lady’s finger, and they securely hold the camera in place without any damage.Compatibility with my MacBook Pro is seamless. The webcam smartly only covers the notch, leaving the rest of the display unobstructed. The touch-sensitive mute button is a gem, perfectly balanced in sensitivity, making it effortless to switch on and off during meetings.The only minor drawback is the need to detach the camera to fully close my laptop screen. However, this is a small trade-off considering the overall quality and performance of the product. If you’re someone who cares about looking professional and crisp in every Zoom meeting, this Opal webcam is a brilliant choice. Highly recommended for its style, functionality, and value!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Mediocre at best. Awful most of the time.
reviews.reviewText: Wanted to like this. It's a nicely marketed product but ultimately, they should have spent more time improving the product for real-world use vs marketing it. Resolution is decent but colors are just awful. Downloading the software gives you plenty of options to adjust settings but you won't get a better image. Don't even bother trying to use it in mixed lighting conditions. If you like looking over-exposed and a weird color then this is the webcam for you. I've got a variety of benchmarks to compare this to: Canon R5 as webcam with RF glass, iPhone Continuity Camera, Logitech Brio, built in Macbook M3 camera etc. I don't expect it to be able to compare with the quality from the R5, but I had hopes for it to be better or at least on the same level as products like the Logitech Brio.There's a high bar now for this kind of product with "Continuity Camera" on iPhone as an alternative and this is simply far inferior to using your iPhone as a webcam. Also, if you dock your Macbook and want to move the camera to a larger screen, you likely won't be able to for two reasons: 1) the supplied cable is too short and not removable (yes you could faff about with an extension but life is too short....) and 2) there's no way to attach it to a larger screen.All in all a waste of money imho.
